critique: The document establishes an advisory committee on small and minority business ownership, composed of high-level officers from US businesses and representatives of minority small businesses. It directs the committee to assist in monitoring and encouraging the placement of subcontracts by the private sector with eligible small businesses, particularly with small minority businesses, and to study and propose incentives and assistance needed by the private sector to help in the training, development, and upgrading of such businesses. The functions of the President under the Federal Advisory Committee Act applicable to the Committee, shall be performed by the Administrator of the Small Business Administration in accordance with guidelines and procedures established by the Administrator of General Services. The committee will terminate on December 31, 1980.
